Authors:
Chintalapati Venkata Ramana, Ch Sasikala, Thota Sravanthi,
Shivani R Yadav
Title:
GC-MS footprint analysis indicates production of several
novel bio-molecules by a few species of Spirochaeta and description of
two new species, Spirochaeta odontotermitis sp. nov. and Spirochaeta
periplaneta sp. nov., isolated from insect guts
Keywords:
Metabolites, Foot-printing, GC-MS, Spirochaeta, novel
species
Abstract:
Metabolite foot print analysis of five members of the
genus Spirochaeta indicated the presence of several important
bio-molecules of pharmaceutical significance. The statistical
interpretation indicated metabolite variations among the two newly
isolated strains compared to the three type strains of the genus
Spirochaeta. Significant metabolite variations between JC202T and JC227T
isolated from hind gut of insects led to polyphasic characterization of
the strains and resulted in the proposal to describe two novel species,
Spirochaeta odontotermitis sp. nov. and Spirochaeta periplanata sp.
nov.
